title: Portion of pre-loaded labels sporadic / inconsistent in appearance
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System:
  Ubunto 18.04
*   When you install doccano:
  12-07-20
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc):
  Docker.  Doccano v1.5
  
  I am using a Docker container to conduct NER labeling on Doccano 1.5. When I import my labels for long documents, almost all of them are there. However, some are visually missing from the GUI, usually a short consecutive sequence of them. If I assume that they are not imported by Doccano, I attempt to relabel them as I cannot see them in the GUI. However, upon refreshing the page, the original labels sometimes re-appear, in addition to my re-labeling that I do when I cannot see the original labels. So the result is, refreshing the page, I can often see something erroneously labeled 2 or 3 times because Doccano did not initially show the label as it should have.

I should say that I am working with long documents. However, it may be that it is a problem resulting from the importing process. I know that Doccano somewhat loads them correctly, as the majority of the labels have no problem being accurately displayed, and refreshing the page sometimes makes the original labels re-appear. I hope this bug is fixed because it is a major blocker for usability of this version. I have had no such display issues with Doccano ~v1.2
